definition: to have a lifeless look in one's eyes (idiom)
as far as the eye can see

sentences.english: Eye contact is sometimes the key to communication.
sentences.chinese: 目光接触是交流中的一个重要环节。

sentences.english: She stood with her back to him, staring at the back wall of his house.
sentences.chinese: 她站在那儿，背对着他，目光注视着房子的后墙。

sentences.english: The way some people looked at her face with disgust seemed to dishearten her even more.
sentences.chinese: 一些人用厌恶的目光看她的脸时似乎使她更加沮丧。

sentences.english: However, Taobao also have a common vision off Amoy, Taobao is indeed a lot of money.
sentences.chinese: 但是淘宝也要有淘客共同的目光，淘宝的确很赚钱。

sentences.english: Pablo looked at him through his bleary eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去目光呆滞，茫然若失。

sentences.english: Half of the time, their eyes will not be on you.
sentences.chinese: 有一半的时间，他们的目光都不会在你的身上。

sentences.english: They gazed in awe at their hero.
sentences.chinese: 那个孩子默默无言，以畏怯的目光凝视着他。

sentences.english: The vision sweeps to take intention in the store.
On the Monkey Mountain the monkeys frolicked and played happily, which attracted the eyes of many tourists.
sentences.chinese: 猴山上猴子们欢闹玩耍，吸引不少游客的目光。

sentences.english: Fixing the boy with a steady look,the teacher forced him to tell the truth.
sentences.chinese: 老师的目光紧紧盯着学生，迫使他说出了真情。

sentences.english: She gave him, straight in the eyes, a look which was also inscrutable.
sentences.chinese: 她还目光炯炯地注视了他一下，这也使他不能理解。

sentences.english: How I love your peaceful eyes on me!
sentences.chinese: 我钟爱你的目光，将我的心轻触。

sentences.english: Harry avoided his yellowish eyes as they scanned the Hall;
sentences.chinese: 他用那双黄眼睛扫视着礼堂，哈利避开了他的目光。

sentences.english: Like a genie, they keep turning up, close by, catching your gaze.
sentences.chinese: 像神怪一般的不断出现，越来越近的吸引着你的目光。

sentences.english: They blush, avert their eyes, hunch their shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 她们会脸红，躲避目光，耸耸肩。

definition: expression or emotion showing in one's eyes/meaningful glance/wink/eyesight (dialect)
attention/to stare at/to fix attention on sth
to watch attentively/to fix one's attention on/to stare at/to gaze at
to gaze at/to fix one's eyes on
to run one's eyes over/to sweep one's eyes over
to raise one's head/to gain ground/account name, or space for writing the name on checks, bills etc
